text: [Music]
hello
my name is aman and i am a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
bangalore
sometimes customers contact us with use
cases in which they want to perform
specific actions based on the source id
of a request this can be achieved by
configuring source ip based listener
rules on alb
in this session i am going to walk you
through the process let's get started
first open the amazon easy to console
in the amazon ec2 console choose load
balancers under load balancing from
navigation pane
now select your application load
balancer that you want to configure the
rules for
choose the listeners tab
select the listener that you want to
configure the rules for and then choose
view edit rules
choose the address icon and then choose
insert rule
choose add condition and then choose
source ip
specify the ip addresses for which you
plan to configure a different action
note that you can specify either a
single ip address or network cidrs with
prefixes
note that a listener rule based on the
source ip condition checks the source ib
address in the ip header
if there is a proxy or firewall in
between the client and the application
load balancer that changes the source ip
then specify the firewall or proxy's ip
address in the listener room
choose add action and then select the
required action for this example i am
selecting forward action
to forward the requests to a different
target group
to save the condition choose check mark
icon
to save the rule choose save
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
